A Week 5 Winner. Week 6 – ANOTHER WIN8 SLATE!

Posted by Brendan Tompkins on October 21, 2011

Congratulations to our week 5 winner, Peter Johanson, with  83 Points!  He’ll be getting The Art of Computer Programming, Volumes 1-4A Boxed Set, The, 3rd Edition.

This week is another big one.  An EXOPC SLATE with the Windows 8 Developer Preview installed!

The feature-rich EXOPC Slate gives you a full PC experience in tablet form. Its unique and user-friendly interface gives you easy access to apps, your favorite websites, your social networks, and anything else you want it to. All this on an 11.6-inch, multi-touch display that’s fun and easy to interact with.

• 2 GB of RAM allows for smooth multitasking among multiple programs and applications
• 1.3-megapixel webcam keeps you in touch with friends, family, and colleagues
• Mini-HDMI port lets you project high-def content onto your big-screen TV
• Energy-efficient Intel Atom Pineview processor designed for longer battery life

We’re changing up the rules for week 6 of  CodeBetter Fantasy Football.  If you’d like to play for this slate, you have to simply mention this post and @codebetter on twitter. We are going to weight your entry based on how many times your tweet is re-tweeted (we will get these counts through our Disqus comment system).  It’s totally fair to beg for re-tweets, the more the better.  Those players with the highest numbers of re-tweets will get the best teams (based on projected scores) going into the games this weekend. The remaining players will get teams randomly.  Clear as mud yet? We will finalize the teams and post them here by 12PM EST on Sunday, October 23rd.   We will announce the winner by 5PM EST on Wednesday October 26th.

Good Luck!

    To be honest, I think this is kind of a stupid idea with the retweets. No one is going to RT your tweet because they want their own to get RT’d instead. Plus it will favor those who have more followers.

  • Brendan Tompkins

    Hey, who said stupid ideas were off limits?

    It very well could be a stupid idea, I agree – but we’re going to see how this works.  It *will* favor folks with more followers,  but at the end of the day, promotions like this are supposed to be promoting the site.  If it gets more eyeballs reading our bloggers’ posts, it’s successful.
